title: Augusta County: Margaret Ott to Enos Ott, December 6, 1864
summary: In this letter to her brother, Margaret writes of efforts to start a petition to get Enos out of the army as well as the efforts of neighbors to harvest their crops. In the postscript, she mentions Confederate efforts to impress slaves from citizens and her refusal to send their slave, Alf, off to them.
keywords: African Americans, Agriculture, Desertion/Leave, Home Front, National Government, American Civil War
